data.description:
Homebrew Reference Book: New Jedi Order Campaign Guide

See also: Force Regimens

This Force Regimen teaches Jedi (And other Force-users) how to fight without using The Force, thus allowing them to focus more closely on what they are doing. This also helps to train Jedi in fighting those opponents who are absent in The Force, such as the Yuuzhan Vong.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber (Or Training Lightsaber) and two sparring Droids.

Make an Initiative check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
18-22 You manage to focus on your opponents improving your dueling skills, but you draw upon The Force after 10 minutes of work to avoid an attack. You gain a +1 Force bonus to your Initiative checks made to Avoid Feint made by your opponent.
23-27 Your focus on one of your opponents greatly improves, as does your dueling skills, but you draw upon The Force after 30 minutes of work to avoid an attack from the second. You gain a +2 Force bonus to your Initiative checks made to Avoid Feint made by your opponent. You also gain 1 temporary Force Point, which can only be used to make Deception checks in order to Feint against an opponent.
28+ Your focus on both of your opponents greatly improves, as does your dueling skills and complete the regimen without drawing upon The Force. You gain a +5 Force bonus to your Initiative checks made to Avoid Feint made by your opponent. You also gain 1 temporary Force Point, which can only be used to make Deception checks in order to Feint against an opponent.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens, Vo'ren Faalo

In Vo'ren's fifth and final cadence, you must demonstrate true mastery over yourself and your Lightsaber. No wax cylinders are required; you simply know when you have made a correct strike. Unlike the other cadences, this Force Regimen requires you to use The Force to manipulate your Lightsaber, an act of pure telekinetic power in which your hands never touch the weapon. This technique brings together the Control, Sense, and Alter aspects of The Force into one training regimen.

Time: 3 Hours

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber

Make a Use the Force check. You take a penalty on your Use the Force check equal to your Dark Side Score. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
31-36 You make a mistake during the first hour. You gain a +1 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Move Light Object application of the skill.
37-42 You make a mistake during the second hour. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Move Light Object application of the skill.
43+ You complete the cadence without making a single mistake. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Move Light Object application of the skill, and you add the Kinetic Combat Force Power to your Force Power Suite. Additionally, you can spend a Force Point to reroll any Use the Force check made to activate a Force Power with the [Telekinetic] descriptor, keeping the better of the two results.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

This Training Regimen trains you to sense images that you cannot normally see by reading the surface thoughts of others. During this Force Regimen, an assistant holds a two-dimensional image viewer so that you can't see the images being displayed in the screen. As the image viewer cycles through different images of common objects, you must read the surface thoughts of the assistant to determine what image is being displayed on the screen at that time.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Requirements: A two-dimensional image display and an assistant.

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
13-17 You successfully read one-third of the assistant's surface thoughts. You gain a +1 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Telepathy application of the Use the Force skill.
18-22 You successfully read two-thirds of the assistant's surface thoughts. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Telepathy application of the Use the Force skill.
23+ You successfully read all of the assistant's surface thoughts. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to use the Telepathy application of the Use the Force skill. In addition, if you successfully use Telepathy against an unwilling target, you can also sense the target's surface emotions and stray thoughts (As determined by the Gamemaster).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens, Vo'ren Faalo

Vo'ren's Second Cadence teaches not only control, but also spacial awareness. You must set up 72 wax cylinders at 5-degree intervals around your body, each one approximately 1.5 meters away. Atop each cylinder, one metal ball bearing is placed. Like Vo'ren's First Cadence, you must place the cylinders and ball bearings one at a time until all 72 have been placed. However, unlike the first cadence, you must strike at all of the cylinders in a full 360-degree arc without turning your body to face the cylinders to he rea, honing your ability to strike at enemies coming from all sides.

Time: 2 Hours

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber, 72 wax cylinders, and 2,701 ball bearings.

Make a Use the Force check. You take a penalty on your Use the Force check equal to your Dark Side Score. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
18-22 You damage two cylinders. You gain a +1 Force bonus on Lightsaber attack rolls against creatures that Flank you.
23-27 You damage one cylinder. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Lightsaber attack rolls against creatures that Flank you.
28+ You complete the cadence without damaging any cylinders. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Lightsaber attack rolls against creatures that Flank you, and you gain the benefits of the Whirlwind Attack Feat (If you do not already know it).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

This Training Regimen is used to awaken another character to the larger world of Force Sensitivity. You and the beneficiary of this Force Regimen practice meditation, quieting your minds and listening to The Force.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: One willing ally who does not possess the Force Sensitivity Feat.

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
13-17 You gain the benefit of the Gauge Force Potential Talent (If you do not already have it).
18-22 You gain the benefit of the Gauge Force Potential Talent (If you do not already have it). Additionally, you awaken the first glimmers of Force Sensitivity in the target. For the next 24 hours, the target can make Untrained Use the Force checks as though he or she possesses the Force Sensitivity Feat.
23-27 You gain the benefit of the Gauge Force Potential Talent (If you do not already have it). Additionally, you awaken the first glimmers of Force Sensitivity in the target. For the next 24 hours, the target can make Untrained Use the Force checks, with a +1 Force bonus, as though he or she possesses the Force Sensitivity Feat.
28+ You gain the benefit of the Gauge Force Potential Talent (If you do not already have it). Additionally, you awaken the first glimmers of Force Sensitivity in the target. For the next 24 hours, the target can make Untrained Use the Force checks, with a +2 Force bonus, as though he or she possesses the Force Sensitivity Feat.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

This Training Regimen trains you to block out distractions and stray thoughts. It requires little more than finding a quiet, secluded spot and slipping into a meditative trance to clear your mind of doubt, questions, fear, and the chaos of the galaxy. Jedi use this technique to open themselves to the flow of The Force, allowing them to see distant places and events.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
13-17 You meditate, but your mind is still clouded by external stimuli. You can add one use of the Farseeing Force Power to your Force Power Suite, but once it is used, it cannot be regained by any means.
18-22 You meditate, quieting your mind except for but a few small distractions. You can add one use of the Farseeing Force Power to your Force Power Suite.
23+ You meditate, quieting your mind entirely. You can add one use of the Farseeing Force Power to your Force Power Suite, and you gain the benefits of the Visions Talent (If you do not already know it).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens, Vo'ren Faalo

Vo'ren's Third Cadence teaches advanced precision through control of one's body and sensory awareness. You set up 180 wax cylinders at 2-degree intervals around your body, each one approximately 1.5 meters away. Atop each cylinder, one metal ball bearing is placed. Unlike Vo'ren's Second Cadence, in the third cadence you must strike every fifth ball bearing, making a rotation around your body several times over the course of this Force Regimen. This prepares you for irregular attack patterns from all sides.

Time: 3 Hours

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber, 180 wax cylinders, and 16,290 ball bearings.

Make a Use the Force check. You take a penalty on your Use the Force check equal to your Dark Side Score. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
23-27 You damage two cylinders. You gain a +1 Force bonus on ranged attack rolls made when using the Redirect Shot Talent.
28-32 You damage one cylinder. You gain a +2 Force bonus on ranged attack rolls made when using the Redirect Shot Talent.
33+ You complete the cadence without damaging any cylinders. You gain a +2 Force bonus on ranged attack rolls made when using the Redirect Shot Talent., and you can spend Force Points to enhance Use the Force checks to Block or Deflect, even when it is not your turn. Furthermore, Force Points spent in this manner do not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit normally applied to spending Force Points.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

This simple Lightsaber Regimen allows you to practice against another living opponent, simulating one-on-one combat. During Sparring Practice, each combatant attempts to strike the other while exercising restraint and control. If you use a Training Lightsaber, you can spar without fear of harming your opponent.

Time: 2 Hours

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber (Or Training Lightsaber) and a sparring partner.

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
18-22 You hone your Lightsaber skills but see little in the way of improvement. You can spend a Force Point to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Block Talent. This does not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit.
23-27 You hone your Lightsaber skills, improving your technique by small degrees. You can spend a Force Point to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Block Talent. This does not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit. You also gain 1 temporary Force Point, which can only be used to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Block Talent.
28+ You hone your Lightsaber skills and see significant improvement in your technique. You can spend a Force Point to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Block Talent. This does not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit. You also gain 2 temporary Force Points, which can only be used to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Block Talent.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

This Training Regimen hones your skill with the Alter aspect of The Force and enhances telekinetic precision. You begin by placing a deep bowl on the ground, with an orb at the bottom of the bowl. First, you must use The Force to hold the bowl perfectly still and pin it to the ground. Then you roll the orb slowly up the side of the bowl, keeping it in contact with the bowl at all times, until it reaches the upper rim. The orb is held there for 5 minutes, and must remain perfectly still. You then roll the orb slowly back to the bottom of the bowl, moving it with The Force and not allowing the orb to move under gravity's power.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Requirements: A deep bowl and a polished stone orb.

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
18-22 You let the bowl move during the regimen. You gain 1 temporary Force Point which you can apply only to a Use the Force check made to activate a Force Power with the [Telekinetic] descriptor.
23-27 You let the orb roll under gravity's power back to it's starting position. You gain 2 temporary Force Points which you can apply only to Use the Force checks made to activate Force Powers with the [Telekinetic] descriptor.
28+ You complete the regimen perfectly. You gain 2 temporary Force Points which you can apply only to Use the Force checks made to activate Force Powers with the [Telekinetic] descriptor or use to reroll a Use the Force check made to activate a Force Power with the [Telekinetic] descriptor (You must keep the second result, even if it is worse).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

You hone your skill at deflecting blaster bolts using your Lightsaber. This Force Regimen is performed blind, often with the help of a helmet equipped with an opaque blast shield.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber, BCA-11/X Training Droid, and a WJ-880 Blinding Helmet.

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
18-22 You hone your Lightsaber skills, but the training remote gets several hits on you. You can spend a Force Point to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Deflect Talent. This does not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit.
23-27 You hone your Lightsaber skills, and the remote gets in a few small hits on you. You can spend a Force Point to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Deflect Talent. This does not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit. You also gain 1 temporary Force Point, which can only be used to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Deflect Talent.
28+ You hone your Lightsaber skills, and the remote never harms you. You can spend a Force Point to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Deflect Talent. This does not count toward the "One Force Point per round" limit. You also gain 2 temporary Force Points, which can only be used to add to the result of a Use the Force check made to activate the Deflect Talent.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens, Vo'ren Faalo

Vo'ren's First Cadence teaches precision through control of one's body and sensory awareness. You set up 19 wax cylinders at 10-degree intervals around your body, each one approximately 1.5 meters away, forming a semicircle. Atop each cylinder, one metal ball bearing is placed. You must then use your Lightsaber to strike each ball bearing without making contact with the wax cylinder beneath it. You must place the cylinders and ball bearings one at a time until all 19 have been placed.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber, 19 wax cylinders, and 190 ball bearings.

Make a Use the Force check. You take a penalty on your Use the Force check equal to your Dark Side Score. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
13-17 You damage two cylinders. You gain a +1 Force bonus to your Will Defense.
18-22 You damage one cylinder. You gain a +2 Force bonus to your Will Defense.
23+ You complete the cadence without damaging any cylinders. You gain a +2 Force bonus to your Will Defense, and you gain the benefits of the Severing Strike Talent (If you do not already know it).

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens

This difficult Training Regimen trains you to master environmental manipulation through The Force. You must first empty a glass bottle of air, creating a perfect vacuum inside. Then you must allow only oxygen to slip past the seal created by The Force, eventually filling the bottle with pure oxygen before placing the vac-seal stopper. This Force Regimen requires you to use The Force in a nearly molecular level, as well as the Sense aspect of The Force to determine what molecules are making their way into the bottle.

Time: 1 Hour

Targets: Self

Requirements: A glass bottle with a vac-seal stopper.

Make a Use the Force check. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
26-31 You fail to create a vacuum in the bottle before the regimen begins, resulting in an imperfect mixture. You gain a +2 Force bonus to your Fortitude Defense against inhaled Poisons and non-corrosive Atmospheric Hazards.
32-37 You create a vacuum in the bottle, but let other molecules enter through your Force seal, creating an imperfect mixture. You gain a +5 Force bonus to your Fortitude Defense against inhaled Poisons and non-corrosive Atmospheric Hazards.
38+ You complete this regimen perfectly, resulting in a bottle full of nothing but pure oxygen. You become immune to inhaled Poisons and non-corrosive Atmospheric Hazards.

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Force Regimens, Vo'ren Faalo

Vo'ren's Fourth Cadence teaches composure and quick thinking amid the chaos of battle. It begins by setting up 360 wax cylinders at 1-degree intervals around your body, each one approximately 1.5 meters away. No ball bearings are required for this cadence. You must strike the cylinders according to a complex mathematical formula. By the time the cadence is completed, you will have learned to perform incredibly taxing mental tasks while also focusing on the external chaos of battle.

Time: 3 Hours

Targets: Self

Requirements: Lightsaber and 360 wax cylinders.

Make a Use the Force check. You take a penalty on your Use the Force check equal to your Dark Side Score. The result of the check determines the benefits of the regimen:

DC EFFECT
26-31 You make a mistake during the first hour. You gain a +1 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to continue maintaining a Force Power whenever you take damage.
32-37 You make a mistake during the second hour. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to continue maintaining a Force Power whenever you take damage.
38+ You make no mistakes during the regimen. You gain a +2 Force bonus on Use the Force checks made to continue maintaining a Force Power whenever you take damage, and if you are damaged while maintaining a Force Power, you can spend a Force Point as a Reaction to not have to make a new Use the Force check.
